page.title: 20BURLEY'S HISTORY
page.content: One of the oldest buildings in Burley is in Burley street.You can find it behind a tall brick wall and it was built in approximately 1300.David Elms was stripping it down and found out that it had{cruck beams.The school was built in 1855 when children started at 5 and finished school at 14.They had a garden in the play ground. A long time ago a horse and cart came to Burley to give Burley their groceries from Ringwood.The 1st road to be tarred was the road up to Picket Post and the main road with the junction at Crow.The only transport was bicycle.One man bought a bus and they called it"the midget" and it took people to Ringwood Market on Wednesdays.In Burley there was a bike shop and a shoe shop but these have now disappeared.Local History Book is called "Records of Burley".
